name: Set of coins of Niue Island dedicated to the means of urban public transport of the Soviet era
description:
Note: The total face value of the set is 8 New Zealand dollars, total accounting net weight – 124.40 g. 
The obverse of the coins depicts a portrait of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain. 
On the reverse of each coin against the background of the city landscape (or underground metro station - for a coin dedicated to the metro), one of the types of urban public transport of the Soviet era is depicted: a bus, a trolley bus. The image of a ticket (or a five-penny coin) in the background illustrates the method of paying for travel on the appropriate form of transport. The main image of the coins is made in color.

name: Coins of the Congo, the Monuments of St. Petersburg series
description:
The obverse depicts the coat of arms of the Democratic Republic of the Congo (formerly Zaire). 
The reverse of the first coin depicts the tower of the Admiralty, as well as one of its wall sculptures near the entrance arch - the composition "Nymphs bearing the heavenly sphere." The image of the building is made in color.

name: Coins of Tuvalu, the Deadly Animals series
description:
The obverse of the coins depicts a portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain. 
The coin's reverse depicts one of five species of predatory animals that inhabit the Australian continent – a large white shark. The individual reverse elements of each coin are highlighted in color. Also, on the reverse, there are inscriptions with the main parameters of the coin and the Russian and Latin names of the depicted animal.

name: Fiji coin set dedicated to the Russian emperor Alexander III
description:
Note: The total face value of the set is 6 New Zealand dollars, total accounting net weight – 93.30 g. 
The obverse of the coins depicts a portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain. 
The reverse of the first coin depicts a portrait of Emperor Alexander III, the second coin shows the coronation ceremony of the emperor, and the royal coin is depicted on the reverse of the third coin. The main image is supplemented in the foreground by the symbols of monarchical power: on the first coin the power is depicted, on the second coin the crown, on the third coin the scepter. Images on the reverse are made in color.

name: Coin of Australia, the Australian Antarctic Territory Series
description:
The obverse of the coin depicts a portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain. 
On the reverse, within the boundaries of the Antarctic contour, there is an image of an iceberg. In the foreground, there is a flying wandering albatross. 
The reverse image is partially made in color.

name: Niue Island coin dedicated to Alphonse Mucha, the Artists of the World Series
description:
The obverse of the coin in color contains a fragment of a lithography by the Czech artist Alfons Mucha “Dance”. In addition, the obverse contains an image of a portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain and typical inscriptions with coin parameters. 
The reverse depicts a color collage based on the lithograph "Advertisement of champagne ‘Moet and Chandon" and a portrait of the artist, indicating his name and years of life.

name: Coin of Niue Island "Guardian Angel"
description:
Note: Clear Capsule with 24K Gold Silver Element, Swarovski crystal 
Obverse: 
On the right – there is a portrait of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II. Below – there is a wave-like inscription: ELIZABETH II. Around the portrait there are inscriptions: NIUE ISLAND (issuing country), 2018 (year of issue), m/w (brand name of the mint), 2 DOLLARS (face value is 2 dollars) and Ag (metal and its purity). 
On the left side – there is a transparent capsule containing a gilded silver element in the shape of an angel. In the background, there are miniature floral motifs. 
Reverse: 
On the left side – there is the figure of an angel holding a magic wand decorated with a crystal. 
On the right – there is a transparent capsule containing a gilded silver element in the shape of an angel. In the background – there are miniature floral motifs (some of which are digitally printed). At the bottom of the coin, in a circle – there is the name of the coin in English: GUARDIAN ANGEL.

name: Coins of the Republic of Benin dedicated to knights (in a set and individually)
description:
Note: The total face value of the set is 2000 West African CFA francs, total net accounting weight – 39.96 g. 
The obverse depicts the national emblem of the Republic of Benin and the face value. 
On the reverse of the first coin an English knight on a horse is depicted in the center in color, in the upper right corner – there is the coat of arms of King Edward III of England. The castle is depicted in the background, below – there is an inscription in English “English Knight.” 
On the reverse of the second coin a German knight on a horse is depicted in the center in color, in the upper right corner – there is the coat of arms of the Holy Roman Empire. The castle is depicted in the background, below – there is an inscription in English “German Knight” (German knight).

name: Coin of Niue Island dedicated to the Russian Empress Anna Ioannovna
description:
The obverse of the coins depicts the cityscape of St. Petersburg with a view of the Neva River. 
On the reverse, in color – there is the Russian Empress Anna Ioannovna; in the foreground – there is a coin from the era of her reign. Above – there is her monogram, below – are the years of rule.

name: Set of Niue coins dedicated to the Arkhangelskoye estate
description:
On the obverse of the central (round) coin – there is a portrait of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II. 
On the reverse of the central (round) coin there is a mother-of-pearl insert resembling the famous pearl “Pelegrina” (La Pelegrina) from the collection of the Yusupov princes. Around her – there is an ornament stylized as a pearl necklace worn by Princess Zinaida Nikolaevna Yusupova (with gilded elements). 
On the obverse of the remaining four coins (non-standard form) – there is a portrait of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II. 
On the reverse of the non-standard coin No. 1 (upper) in the center there is a view of the palace, which is the center of the architectural and park ensemble of the Yusupovs estate, Arkhangelskoye. Around it is an ornament stylized as a pearl necklace (with gilded elements). 
On the reverse of the non-standard coin No. 2 (lower) in the center, there is a view of the Yusupovs Tomb (“Colonnade”), the last building of the Arkhangelskoye estate. Around her is an ornament stylized as a pearl necklace (with gilded elements). 
On the reverse of the non-standard coin No. 3 (left) in the center, there is a portrait of Prince Nikolai Borisovich Yusupov, the first owner (of the Yusupov family) of the Arkhangelskoye estate. Under it is the name and surname of the prince in English: Nikolai Yusupov. Around the portrait there is an ornament stylized as a pearl necklace (with gilded elements). 
On the reverse of the non-standard coin No. 4 (right) in the center, there is a portrait of Princess Zinaida Nikolaevna Yusupova, the famous beauty of the time, the last owner (of the Yusupov family) of the Arkhangelskoye estate. Below - there is the name and surname of the princess in English: Zinaida Yusupova. Around the portrait there is an ornament stylized as a pearl necklace (with gilded elements).

name: Coins of France dedicated to the International Year of Astronomy
description:
The obverse stylized depicts a footprint on the lunar soil left by the American astronaut Neil Armstrong – the first person to set foot on the moon (in 1969). The inscription in French, depicted along the edging, stands for "40th anniversary of the first landing of a man on the moon." 
On the reverse of the coins – there is a stylized image of a starry sky with a planet. There are also images of 10 symbols of the planets of the solar system and an inscription with the name of the series ("2009 is the International Year of Astronomy").

name: Coin of Kazakhstan dedicated to Attila, the Great Conquerors Series
description:
On the obverse is a warrior galloping on a horse, shooting from a bow. 
On the left is the coat of arms of Kazakhstan. 
On the reverse in the center, there is a gilded image of an old medallion with a portrait of Attila - the leader of the Huns (5th century), who became famous for the devastating campaigns on the territory of European countries. At the bottom of the reverse is a stylized scroll with images of galloping warriors.

name: Coin of Belarus featuring the Akhal-Teke breed horse
description:
The obverse of the coin depicts running horses. There are also inscriptions with the parameters of the coin and an image of the national emblem of Belarus. 
On the reverse in the foreground – there is the stallion of the Akhal-Teke horse - the oldest of the breeds of horse culture. In the background – there is a Greek chariot of vase painting of Ancient Greece (highlighted in color), as well as the ionic columns of ancient Greek architecture. 
On the left, there is an inscription “Akhal-Teke horse” in Belarusian.
original_equipment: blister, combined with certificate of authenticity

name: Coins of Andorra dedicated to Extreme Sports
description:
The obverse of the coins depicts the coat of arms of the Principality of Andorra. Face value of the coin (10 diners) is abbreviated 
On the obverse (“10 D.”). 
The reverse of the coin carries a bright color image of a cyclist against the backdrop of a summer mountain landscape. Under the main image of the coin there is an inscription “XTREME” (EXTREME).
original_equipment: clear plastic capsule, certificate of authenticity

name: Coins of Australia featuring a Cub Bandicoot, the Australian series "Cubs of Animals - the Inhabitants of the Australian bush"
description:
The obverse of the coins depicts a portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain. 
On the reverse, there is a color image of a cub of a rabbit bandicoot – marsupial animal of Australia – against a background of vegetation. The image of the coin is made in the style of drawings for children.

name: Coins of Niue Island dedicated to St. Petersburg
description:
The obverse of the coins depicts a portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain. 
The reverse of the first coin shows the modern (on the left side) and the old (on the right side) building of the City Duma with its multi-tiered tower in the main street of St. Petersburg - Nevsky Prospect. Below – there is an inscription “Growing through the Ages”. 
The reverse of the second coin depicteds the city landscape of St. Petersburg in color with a view of the Neva River and the bascule bridge. In the foreground – there is the Sphinx. Also, there is an inscription at the top “White Nights”. 
The reverse of the third coin depicts the famous monument to the founder of St. Petersburg, Tsar Peter I, against the background of the Vasilyevsky Island direction sign. To the left of the monument, there is an inscription "Building the future".

name: Coins of the Cook Islands Series “Save Our World”
description:
On the obverse of the coins – there is a portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain, above – there is an inscription – “ELIZABETH II · COOK ISLANDS”, below – there is an inscription indicating the weight of the coin, purity, metal, year of issue and face value “1oz 999 SILVER · 2013 · ONE DOLLAR”. 
On the reverse of the first coin in the center – there is the image of two pandas made in color, below - two hands holding the globe. Above – there is the inscription “SAVE OUR WORLD - GIANT PANDA”. 
On the reverse of the second coin in the center - the image of two polar bears made in color, below - two hands holding the globe. Above – there is the inscription “SAVE OUR WORLD - POLAR BEAR”.
original_equipment: blister combined with an authenticity certificate

name: Coins of the Republic of Macedonia of the Zodiac Series.
description:
On the obverse of the coins in the center – there are Atlantes holding the vault of heaven framed by the symbols of the zodiac signs. On the insert made of cobalt glass (weight 2.9 ±0.2 g), there is the image of the northern sky with the constellation corresponding to the name of the coin. Below – there is a fragment of a drawing of the solar system against the background of a star map. There is also an image of the coat of arms of the Republic of Macedonia and the inscription “РЕПУБЛИКА МАКЕДОНИJA”, below is the year of issue of coins – 2018. 
On the reverse of the coins in the upper part, the zodiac sign from the star atlas of Jan Hevelius of the17th century (to which the coin is dedicated) is depicted, as well as the corresponding constellation. Above – there is the stamped image of the symbol of the given sign. Below – there is a symbolic modern image of the zodiac sign, painted in gold paint, against the background of a model of the solar system. There is also a coined name for the corresponding zodiac sign in Latin, its face value and purity.

name: Coins of the Republic of Belarus of the series “Orthodox Icons” featuring the Icon of the Virgin “Miracle”
description:
On the obverse of the coins in the center, there is a cross framed by patterns. In the upper and lower parts of the obverse, there are inscriptions with coin parameters and an image of the state emblem of the Republic of Belarus. 
The reverse of the coin depicts the Icon of the Mother of God “The Sign”, one of the most revered icons of the Russian Orthodox Church. Below – the inscription in Belarusian “ЗНАМЕНИЕ” (MIRACLE). Individual elements of the reverse of silver coins are gilded.

name: Coins of the Republic of Belarus, Orthodox Icons Series featuring the icon of the Virgin of Iver and the icon of the Virgin of Smolensk
short_name: Virgin of Iver (Belarus) – 13; Virgin of Smolensk (Belarus) – 13
description:
On the obverse of the coins in the center, there is a cross framed by patterns. In the upper and lower parts of the obverse there are inscriptions with coin parameters and an image of the state emblem of the Republic of Belarus. 
The reverse of the first coin depicts the Iveron Icon of the Mother of God, one of the most revered icons of the Orthodox world, the shrine of the Iversky monastery on Mount Athos. Below – there is an inscription in Belarusian language "IВЕРСКАЯ". 
The second coin's reverse depicts the Smolensk Icon of the Mother of God, also, one of the most revered miracle-working icons in Russia, the shrine of Smolensk. Below – there is an inscription in Belarusian “СМАЛЕНСКАЯ”. Individual elements of the reverse of silver coins are gilded.

name: Coins of the Republic of Belarus Orthodox Icons Series
description:
On the obverse of the coins in the center, there is a cross framed by patterns. In the upper and lower parts of the obverse there are inscriptions with coin parameters and an image of the state emblem of the Republic of Belarus. 
On the reverse of the second coin, the Minsk icon of the Mother of God is depicted - the main Orthodox shrine of Belarus. Below - the inscription in Belarusian language " МIНСКАЯ". Individual elements of the reverse of silver coins are gilded.

name: Coin of Niue Islands, the Cartoon Characters Series
description:
On the obverse of the coins in the upper part, there is a portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain, in the lower part – there are stylized films and individual frames depicting cartoon characters. 
The reverse depicts the main characters (made in color) of the famous Polish animated series directed by V. Negrebetskoy "Bolek and Lolek"in the center; the cartoon was first released in 1964. In the background of the reverse, there are scenes from the series of the animated film "Bolek and Lolek in the Wild West."
original_equipment: blister combined with an authenticity certificate

name: Coins of the Niue series The Alphabet of lizabeth Boehm
description:
The obverse of the coins depicts a portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain and an inscription in English “Russian alphabet”. 
On the reverse of the first coin, there are color images of an angel and letters of the Old Slavic alphabet “Az”. 
On the reverse of the second coin, there are color images of an angel and the letters of the Old Slavonic alphabet “Buki”. 
On the reverse of the third coin, there are color images of an angel and the letters of the Old Slavic alphabet “Vedi”.
original_equipment: blister combined with an authenticity certificate

name: Coins of Niue Island Dedicated to the Year of the Ox
description:
The obverse of the coins depicts a portrait of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain. 
The reverse of the first coin depicts a bull lying on the grass surrounded by bamboo trees (on the right – highlighted in color). The design is complemented by a color image of lilies in the foreground. 
On the reverse of the second coin is a calf lying surrounded by stylized flowers (highlighted in color).

name: Coins of Armenia, the Kings of Football Series
description:
The logo of the series is depicted 
On the obverse of the coins - the inscription “Kings of Football”, made in the form of a throne on a pedestal and crowned with a stylized crown. The logo is complemented by images of two lions and a ball. The state emblem of the Republic of Armenia is located below the main image. 
On the reverse of each coin is a portrait of a famous football player: on the first coin - Zbigniew Boniek, on the second coin - Franz Beckenbauer. In the background – there is a stylized flying ball with a bright plume made in the colors of the national flag of the country corresponding to the athlete: Poland and Germany.

name: Coin of the Republic of Tanzania in the form of a fan,
description:
The coin is made in the shape of a Chinese fan. 
The obverse of the coins depicts the state emblem of the Republic of Tanzania. 
On the reverse, goats and a tree branch are depicted in the color in the style of Chinese painting; on the right – a Chinese character denoting a sheep / ram.

name: Coin of the Republic of Benin featuring the Scandinavian Viking
description:
The obverse depicts the national emblem of the Republic of Benin and the face value. 
On the reverse, the coins depict the Scandinavian Viking – in the center in color; in the lower part – there is an inscription in English “Viking” and the year of issue – 2015. A Viking ship is depicted in the background, as well as the traditional ornament of the northern people – also depicted on the coin.

name: Victor Tsoi - 12 Fiji coin dedicated to the 50th birthday of Viktor Tsoi
description:
The obverse depicts a portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain. 
The reverse depicts a portrait of the famous Soviet rock musician Viktor Tsoi – in colour, combined with a fragment of the “Tsoi wall” (located in Moscow on Arbat St.) with inscriptions from fans. 
On the left - there is a guitar, as well as a receding figure of a singer walking along an alley.
original_equipment: Capsule, blister combined with an authenticity certificate

name: Coin of Niue Island featuring the Pronghorn, the Unusual in Nature Series
description:
The obverse of the coin depicts a rhombus with a smooth surface and a portrait of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain in the center. In the background, the reverse surface is filled with a stylized image of plants and traces of animal paws. 
On the reverse, the relief shows a pronghorn running along the prairie – a cloven-hoofed animal, the uniqueness of which is that with the annual dropping of horns, it only loses their horn cover, and the bone base always remains. The relief image of the pronghorn is repeated in the form of two more figures depicted as a silhouette. At the bottom – there is an inscription with the Latin name of the species.

name: Coins of Niue, Domestic Cat
description:
The obverse of the coins depicts a portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain. 
On the reverse of each coin, there are cats of one of three breeds in color: Bengal, Scottish fold and Kuril bobtail. At the bottom, there is an inscription with the name of the breed, and on the right – the name of the series – “Our Friends” (in English).

name: Coin of the Republic of Macedonia of the Zodiac Series.
description:
On the obverse of the coin in the center – there is an hourglass, on the left – a color image of the sun, on the right – a crescent with stars; above – the coat of arms of the Republic of Macedonia and the inscription “РЕПУБЛИКА МАКЕДОНИJA”, below - the year of issue of coins – 2014, its face value and purity. 
On the reverse of the coin on the left side, there is the zodiac sign to which the coin is dedicated. Part of the zodiac sign is painted gold. 
On the right side of the coin there is a round insert made of cobalt glass, which shows the starry sky and the constellation of the corresponding zodiac sign. Along the contour of the coin, there is an ornament, also made with the golden color of individual elements. At the bottom of the coin, there is a symbolic designation and the name of the corresponding zodiac sign in Latin.

name: Coins of the Republic of Macedonia of the Zodiac Series
description:
On the obverse of the coins in the center, there are Atlantes holding the vault of heaven framed by the symbols of the zodiac signs. On the insert made of cobalt glass (weighing 2.9 ±0.2 g), there is the image of the northern sky with the constellation corresponding to the name of the coin. Below is a fragment of a drawing of the solar system on the background of a star map. There is also an image of the coat of arms of the Republic of Macedonia and the inscription: “РЕПУБЛИКА МАКЕДОНИJA”, below is the year of issue of coins – 2018. 
On the reverse of the coins in the upper part, the zodiac sign from the star atlas of Jan Hevelius of the 17th century is depicted, to which the coin is dedicated, as well as the corresponding constellation. Above – there is the stamped image of the symbol of the given sign. Below – there is a symbolic modern image of the zodiac sign, painted in gold, against the background of a model of the solar system. There is also a coined name for the corresponding zodiac sign in Latin, its face value and purity.

name: Coins of Niue Island with a picture of Yutaki Kagai paintings, the Zodiac series
description:
The obverse of the coins depicts a portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain. Along the edge of the obverse, there are graphic symbols of the zodiac sign. 
On the reverse of each coin, there is a fragment of the painting of the Zodiac series by the famous contemporary Japanese artist Yutaki Kagai, who works in computer technique in a fantasy style; the fragment is made in color. 
The reverse is supplemented by a graphic symbol of the zodiac sign and inscriptions with its name in Greek (above) and Latin (below) languages and dates corresponding to the sign.
original_equipment: blister combined with an authenticity certificate

name: Set of Niue coins dedicated to the Vorontsov Palace
description:
Note: total face value of the set – 10 New Zealand dollars, total net accounting weight – 81.29 g. 
On the obverse of the central (round) coin, there is a portrait of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II. 
On the reverse of the central (round) coin in the center, there is a cornelian inset. Around it – a gilded ornament stylized as Russian architecture of the XIX century. Above and below – a semicircular inscription in English: Vorontsov Palace / Crimea. 
On the obverse of the remaining four coins (non-standard shape), there is a portrait of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II. 
On the reverse of the custom coin No. 1 (top) in the center – a view of the south facade of the Vorontsov Palace (in the Moorish style). Around it – there is a gilded ornament stylized as Russian architecture of the 19th century. 
On the reverse of the non-standard coin No. 2 (bottom) in the center - a view of the northern facade of the Vorontsov Palace (in the Gothic style). Around it – is a gilded ornament stylized as Russian architecture of the 19th century. 
On the reverse of the custom coin No. 3 (left) in the center, there is a portrait of Princess Elizabeth Ksaverievna Vorontsova. Under the portrait is her first and last name in English: Elizabeth Vorontsova. The coin is decorated with a gilded ornament stylized as Russian architecture of the XIX century. 
On the reverse of a non-standard coin No. 4 (right) in the center - there is a portrait of Count Mikhail Semenovich Vorontsov, the commissioner and first owner of the palace. Under the portrait, his name and surname are in English: Mikhail Vorontsov. The coin is decorated with a gilded ornament stylized as Russian architecture of the XIX century.

name: Coin of Niue Island “All the Best”
description:
Obverse: In the center, there is a portrait of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II. Below the portrait, there are the initials of the sculptor Ian Rank-Broadley, who created this portrait (IRB - Ian Rank-Broadley), the mint's trademark (m/w), metal and its purity (Ag 925). On the circumference – inscriptions: ELIZABETH II / NIUE ISLAND (issuer) / I DOLLAR (face value) / 2017 (year of manufacture). Above – there is a small round hole. 
Reverse: In the center – there are images of a ladybug, feather, heart, four-leaf clover and horseshoe – made using the digital printing technique. In the background – a floral ornament. Below – an inscription in English: All the best (Well-being). Above – there is a small round hole.

name: Vysotsky -18
description:
On January 23, 2018, the Bank of Russia issued a commemorative silver coin with a face value of 25 rubles “Creative life by Vladimir Vysotsky” (mass of the precious metal 155.5 g, alloy purity 925, catalog number 5115-0141). The coin has a round shape with a diameter of 60.0 mm. Both 
On the obverse and reverse of the coin, around there is a protruding edge the circumference. On the front side of the coin, there is a relief image of the State Emblem of the Russian Federation, there are inscriptions: “РОССИЙСКАЯ ФЕДЕРАЦИЯ” (RUSSIAN FEDERATION), “БАНК РОССИИ” (BANK OF RUSSIA), Face value of the coin - “25 РУБЛЕЙ” (25 RUBLES), date – “2018”, metal designation according to the Periodic system of elements D. I. Mendeleev, alloy purity, trademark of the Moscow Mint and the mass of the precious metal. 
On the reverse side of the coin are relief images of V.S. Vysotsky with a guitar, to his left – there is a sword and the image of horses made using the laser matting technique. Also, there is an inscription at the circumference at the top “ВЛАДИМИР ВЫСОЦКИЙ” (VLADIMIR VYSOTSKY), below on the right – there are two-line dates “1938” and“1980”. The edge of the coin is reeded. The coin has "proof" quality. The mintage is 1.5 thousand pieces.

name: Coin of the Republic of Benin dedicated to Vladimir Vysotsky
description:
The obverse depicts the national emblem of the Republic of Benin and its face value. 
The reverse shows the famous actor, poet, author and performer of his own songs, Vladimir Vysotsky, holding a guitar, - in color. In the background, the city landscape, a curved line repeating a fragment of a guitar. 
On the left side on the matte field, there is a stamped figure of the musician sitting with a guitar, years of life. Also, in the upper part of the coin, there is an inscription in English “VLADIMIR VYSOTSKY”, in the lower part there is an inscription in Russian “ВЛАДИМИР ВЫСОЦКИЙ”. On the edge – there is an ornament.
original_equipment: capsule, certificate of authenticity, case stylized as an audio cassette

name: Coin of Niue Island, dedicated to the famous commander of antiquity – Hannibal
description:
On the left and right of the obverse, the coin shows the war elephants whom the Carthaginian commander Hannibal Barka (III-II centuries BC) used in his military campaigns. Steel armor on the heads is decorated with inserts of a translucent stone of turquoise color. The portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain is depicted on the background of the Carthaginian shield. 
The reverse depicts the scene of the famous military campaign of the Hannibal army in Italy through the Alps: soldiers are depicted moving on combat elephants against the backdrop of mountain ranges. At the top of the reverse – there is a portrait of Hannibal, taken from a coin minted in his era. Below - are the years of the commander's life.

name: Set of coins of Niue Island
description:
Note: total face value of the set – 8 New Zealand dollars, total net accounting weight – 124.40 g. 
The obverse of the coins depicts a portrait of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain. 
On the reverse of each coin, against the background of the city landscape (or underground metro station - for a coin dedicated to the metro), one of the types of urban public transport of the Soviet era is depicted: a bus, a trolley bus, a tram and a metro train. The image of a ticket (or a five-penny coin) in the background illustrates the method of paying for travel via the appropriate form of transport. The main image of the coins is made in color.

name: Coins of the Cook Islands dedicated to the year of the Rabbit of the lunar calendar
short_name: Two hares (the Cook Islands) – 11 (for all coins with an image of two hares)
description:
The obverse of the coins depicts a portrait of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain. 
On the reverse side of each coin, there is a color image of a hare (rabbits) in a natural landscape, stylized in the form of watercolor and pencil drawing, made in warm colors. Coin reverse designs are partially different.

name: Set of Niue coins "Sheremetev's Palaces"
description:
On the obverse of the coins, there is a portrait of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II, face value, year of issue. 
On the reverse of the central (round) coin, there is a gilded image of a lyre repeating the ornamental motif of the decoration of the ballroom in the Fountain House. In a semicircle, there is an inscription in English “Sheremetev palaces.” The coin ornament has selective gilding. 
On the reverse of a non-standard coin No. 1 (top) in the center – a view of the facade of the Fountain House (St. Petersburg). Around it, there is an ornament with partial gilding. 
On the reverse of a non-standard coin No. 2 (bottom) in the center – a view of the facade of the Ostankino Palace (Moscow). Around it – an ornament with partial gilding. 
On the reverse of a custom coin No. 3 (left) in the center – is a portrait of Nikolai Sheremetyev, a Russian statesman, philanthropist, patron of the arts of the 18th century. Above and below the portrait, there are inscriptions with the name and surname in English: NIKOLAY SHEREMETEV. The coin ornament has partial gilding. 
On the reverse of the non-standard coin No. 4 (right) in the center - there is a portrait of the artist of the Sheremetyevs' serf theater (subsequently the wife of Count Sheremetyev) Praskovia Zhemchugova. Above and below the portrait, there are inscriptions with the name and surname in English: PRASKOVIA ZHEMCHUGOVA. The coin ornament has partial gilding.

name: Coins of the Republic of Macedonia of the Zodiac Series.
description:
On the obverse of the coins in the center, there is an hourglass, on the left – a color image of the sun, on the right – a crescent with stars. above – the emblem of the Republic of Macedonia and the inscription “РЕПУБЛИКА МАКЕДОНИJA”, below – the year of issue of coins, face value and purity. Also, along the contour there are 8 symbols denoting the signs of the zodiac. 
On the reverse of the coins on the left side, there is the zodiac sign to which the coin is dedicated. Part of the zodiac sign is painted gold. 
On the right side of the coin there is a round insert made of cobalt glass, which shows the starry sky and the constellation of the corresponding zodiac sign. On the contour of the coin there is an ornament (for each coin its own), also made with the golden color of individual elements. At the bottom of the coin, there is a symbolic designation and the name of the corresponding zodiac sign in Latin.

name: Coins of the Republic of Macedonia of the Zodiac Series.
description:
On the obverse of the coins in the center, there are Atlantes holding the vault of heaven framed by the symbols of the zodiac signs. On the insert made of cobalt glass (weighing 2.9 ±0.2 g), the image of the northern sky with the constellation corresponding to the name of the coin. Below – there is a fragment of a drawing of the solar system on the background of a star map. There is also an image of the coat of arms of the Republic of Macedonia and the inscription “РЕПУБЛИКА МАКЕДОНИJA”, below – there is the year of issue of coins – 2018. 
On the reverse of the coins in the upper part, the zodiac from the star atlas of Jan Hevelius of the 17th century to which the coin is dedicated is depicted, as well as the corresponding constellation. Above – there is the stamped image of the symbol of the given sign. Below – there is a symbolic modern image of the zodiac sign painted gold, against the background of a model of the solar system. Above – there is the stamped image of the symbol of the given sign. Below – there is a symbolic modern image of the zodiac sign, painted in gold paint, against the background of a model of the solar system. There is also a coined name for the corresponding zodiac sign in Latin, face value and purity.

name: Coins of Niue Island with the image of Grandfather Frost (Santa Claus) and Snow Maiden
description:
The obverse of the coin depicts a portrait of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain. 
On the reverse in the center, there is a partially colored image of Santa Claus with a Snow Maiden framed by an ornament resembling a snowflake.

name: Dinosaurs, Marine Dinosaurs Dinosaur coins of Niue
description:
The obverse of the coins depicts the globe, prehistoric plants and a portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain. 
The reverse of the first coin depicts Jurassic dinosaurs against a background of vegetation: pterodactyls (at the top) and color images of the allosaurus (on the left) and diplodocus (on the right). Above – there is the inscription “LIFE ON EARTH · JURA · DINOSAURIA.” 
The reverse of the second coin depicts marine dinosaurs of the Jurassic period: from left to right, a dacosaurus, megalnosaurus, plesiosaurus, and shonizaur. Above – there is the inscription “LIFE ON EARTH · JURA · DINOSAURIA”
original_equipment: blister combined with an authenticity certificate

name: Airships Fiji Coins Set with Airships
short_name: Airships set (Fiji) – 09; Short name of the coin: Airship “USSR-V6” (Fiji) – 09
description:
Note: total face value of the set – 8 долларов Fiji dollars, total net accounting weight – 124.40 g. 
The obverse of the coins depicts a portrait of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain. 
The reverse side of each coin is a color image of one of the four airships against the background of the city landscape corresponding to the country of the device’s developer: the American airship Akron, the Soviet USSR-V6 (the largest Soviet airship, which in 1937 set a world record for flight duration), German "Hindenburg" and English "R-34 ". There is also an inscription with the name of the series in which these coins were issued - “Famous Aircrafts” (in English).
original_equipment: certificate of authenticity, case (both for a set and for an individual coin)

name: Coins of the Congo dedicated to the Year of the Dragon of the lunar calendar
description: The obverse depicts the coat of arms of the Democratic Republic of the Congo. The main design element of the reverse of each coin is a bright color picture with the image of a dragon surrounded by objects-symbols associated with the wish word indicated at the bottom of the reverse. The inscription below the picture of each coin means, respectively, “happy”, “lucky”, “successful” and “rich”.

name: Coin of Niue Island dedicated to Russian Empress Catherine II
description:
The obverse depicts the building of the Assignation Bank in St. Petersburg, established by Catherine II to issue paper money. 
The reverse depicts the color of the Russian Empress Catherine II and, in the foreground, a coin from the era of her reign: two gold rubles of 1785 for palace use. In the background is a fragment of the inscription from the 25-ruble bank note of the Catherine’s era.

name: Coins of Malawi, series dedicated to the palaces of the environs of St. Petersburg
description:
The obverse of the coins depicts the state emblem of the Republic of Malawi. 
The reverse of each coin depicts one of the four largest palaces in the environs of St. Petersburg, which served as suburban residences of Russian emperors: on the first coin – the Grand Catherine Palace, located in the city of Pushkin; on the second coin – the Konstantinovsky Palace (with a monument to Peter I), located in Strelna; on the third coin – the Pavlovsk Palace (with a monument to Paul I), located in Pavlovsk, and on the fourth coin – the Great Peterhof Palace (with the central fountain-monument “Samson tearing the mouth of a lion”), located in Peterhof. The image of the building on the reverse of each coin is made in color.

name: Coins of Australia, Discover Australia Series
description:
The obverse of the coins depicts a portrait of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain. 
On the reverse of the coin dedicated to the city of Broome, there is a color image of a pearl shell with white pearls against a landscape with a seacoast, palm trees and a sailing yacht.
original_equipment: certificate of authenticity, case with wooden lid

name: Coins of Rwanda featuring the Royal Heron and the Giraffe
description:
On the obverse of the coin in the center, there is the national emblem of the Republic of Rwanda. 
The reverse of the first coin depicts whaleheads (king herons), the second coin – giraffes against the background of the African landscape traditional for the habitat of these animals. The relief images of animals are gilded, and the eyes are made in the form of diamond inserts weighing 0.002 g each (a total of 4 inserts).

name: Coin of Niue Island in the shape of a stylized asterisk
description:
The coin has the shape of a star with seven rays. 
On the obverse in the center, there is a portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain framed with inscriptions denoting the issuing country, face value, purity and year of issue of the coin. The rest of the obverse is made in the form of a pattern of stylized snowflakes of various shapes and sizes. 
The reverse depicts a winter landscape with an angel sitting on a crescent and holding a star. In the foreground, there is a branch with cones, made in color. The star is made in the form of an insert of a translucent yellow crystal.

name: Coins of Australia of the Lunar Calendar series dedicated to the year of the Snake(series II)
description:
The obverse of the coins depicts a portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain. 
The reverse of silver coins depicts a snake hanging on a branch. 
The reverse of the gold coins depicts a snake among bamboo, made in color.

name: Coins of Benin series "Decorative dogs"
description:
The obverse depicts the national emblem of the Republic of Benin. 
On the reverse of each coin, a close-up shows a dog (made in color) of one of the breeds of indoor decorative dogs: on the first coin, there is the Yorkshire terrier, on the second coin – a Chinese crested dog, and on the third coin is an orange dwarf spitz. 
On the right side of the reverse is a stylized figure of a girl (made partially in color) holding a dog of the corresponding breed on a leash. At the top of the reverse is the name of the breed in French.
original_equipment: blister combined with an authenticity certificate

name: Coins of Niue Island dedicated to the Patriotic War of 1812
short_name: Infantry of 1812 (Niue) – 12, Cavalry of 1812 (Niue) – 12, Generals of 1812 (Niue) – 12
description:
The obverse of the coin depicts a portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain. 
The reverse of the first three coins depicts soldiers of one of the types of troops of the Russian army operating during the Patriotic War of 1812: infantry or cavalry. 
On the reverse of the fourth coin the main military leaders of the Russian army are depicted: M.I. Kutuzov, Emperor Alexander I and M. Barclay de Tolly. The figure in the foreground is highlighted. Also, on the reverse, there are elements that indicated on the military maps the number, location and direction of movement of the troops: arrows (highlighted in color) and groups of rectangles.
original_equipment: blister combined with an authenticity certificate

name: Kidnapping, Caucasian Style Niue Silver coin set «Kidnapping, Caucasian Style or Shurik's New Adventures»
description:
Note: total face value of the set – 6 New Zealand dollars, total accounting net weight - 93.3 g. 
The obverse of the coins depicts a portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain. 
The reverse of the coin depicts scenes from the film by Leonid Gaidai “Kidnapping, Caucasian Style, or Shurik's New Adventures,” made in color. At the top of each coin, there is the inscription in Russian “КАВКАЗСКАЯ ПЛЕННИЦА” (Kidnapping, Caucasian Style). The first coin depicts the movie characters Jabrail and comrade Saahov. The second coin depicts the movie characters Shurik and Nina. The third coin depicts the movie heroes Coward, Experienced, Dunce.

name: Kizhi-15
description:
A silver coin with a face value of 3 rubles "Kizhi", (catalog number 5111-0313), (the mass of the precious metal is 31.1 g, purity of alloy – 925) has a round shape with a diameter of 39.0 mm. 
On the obverse and reverse of the coin around the circumference, there is a protruding edge. 
On the obverse of the coin, there is a relief image of the emblem of the Bank of Russia – a two-headed eagle with its wings down, under it there is an inscription in a semicircle "БАНК РОССИИ" (BANK OF RUSSIA) – in a circle framed by a bead rim; also, around the circumference there are inscriptions separated by dots: "ТРИ РУБЛЯ" (THREE RUBLES) – the face value of the coin and the year of minting – 2015;between them, there is a metal designation according to the Periodic system of chemical elements Mendeleev, its purity, brand name of the St. Peretsburg mint and the weight of the precious metal. 
The reverse of the coin depicts a relief image of the Church of the Transfiguration of the Lord from the architectural ensemble of the Kizhi churchyard of the State Historical, Architectural and Ethnographic Museum-Reserve "Kizhi." Also, there are inscriptions: above the circumference – "СИМВОЛЫ РОССИИ" (SYMBOLS OF RUSSIA), below – "КИЖИ" (KIZHI). The edge of the coins is reeded. The coins are of "proof" quality. The mintage is 10000 pieces.

name: Discover Australia: The Litoria Frog, Red Kangaroo, Whale Shark, Kookaburra
short_name: Litoria Frog (Australia) – 12, Kookaburra (Australia) – 12, Red kangaroo (Australia) – 12, Whale shark (Australia) – 12
description:
The obverse of the coins depicts a portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain. 
The reverse of the first coin depicts a golden litoria sitting on a branch; these frog species can be found only in Australia and New Zealand. In the background, there is a landscape with the famous rock Three Sisters in the Blue Mountains, made in color. The second coin shows a whale shark swimming along the reef bottom of the ocean (made in color). 
The reverse of the third coin depicts a kookaburra sitting on a branch – one of Australia's most famous birds. The sunrise on the Murray River is depicted as a background, made in color. 
The reverse of the fourth coin depicts a red kangaroo on a colored background depicting a typical landscape of the Australian outback with a windmill.

name: Coins of Tuvalu, the Deadly Animals series
description:
The obverse of the coins depicts a portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain. 
The reverse of each coin depicts one of five species of predatory animals that inhabit the Australian continent: a red-backed spider, an Australian blue-ringed octopus, a great white shark, an Australian eastern brown snake, and an Australian sea crocodile. The individual reverse elements of each coin are highlighted in color. Also, on the reverse, there are inscriptions with the main parameters of the coin and the Russian and Latin names of the depicted animal.

name: Coin of Niue Island dedicated to Claude Monet, Artists of the World Series
description:
The obverse of the coin depicts a painting in color by the French impressionist painter Claude Monet, “A Lady with an Umbrella, Turned to the Right,” which is one of the versions of the famous plot of several paintings by the artist with a picture of a woman walking on a flowering lawn and hiding from the sun with an umbrella. At the bottom, there is also a relief image of a portrait of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain. 
The reverse depicts a portrait of Claude Monet with a facsimile of signature and years of life against the background of a color image of the artist’s famous painting “A Pond with Water Lilies”.

name: Coin of the Republic of Congo "Key to the Heart."
short_name: Key to the Heart (Republic of Congo) – 17
description:
The obverse of the coins depicts the coat of arms of the Republic of the Congo and the face value – 500 CFA francs. The inscription “Republic of the Congo” is in French. 
On the reverse of the coin, there is a chased image of two swans, a couple in love, a gilded pair of rings, a color image of a water lily. The inscription “Whoever has the key can open my heart” is in English; also, there is a year of mintage – 2017. The blank of the coin has a keyhole-shaped opening, into which the brass key weighing 0.57 ±/- 0.1 g is placed.
original_equipment: capsule, blister combined with certificate of authenticity, 2 metal chains, brass key

name: Koala with Opal Australian coin featuring the koala, the Opal Insert Series
description:
The obverse depicts a portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain against a background of stylized rays diverging in a circle. 
On the reverse in the center, there is a round insert of a real Australian opal with a picture of a koala sitting on a tree. Around the insert, there is a relief image of the branches of eucalyptus with flowers, the moon in the phase of the new moon and the Southern Cross constellation (visible only in the southern hemisphere).

name: Coins of the Republic of Macedonia of the Zodiac Series.
description:
On the obverse of the coins in the center, there are Atlantes holding the vault of heaven framed by the symbols of the zodiac signs. On the insert made of cobalt glass (weighing 2.9 ±0.2 g), there is an image of the northern sky with the constellation corresponding to the name of the coin. Below – there is a fragment of a drawing of the solar system on the background of a star map. There is also an image of the coat of arms of the Republic of Macedonia and the inscription “РЕПУБЛИКА МАКЕДОНИJA”, below – there is the year of issue of coins – 2018. 
On the reverse of the coins in the upper part, the zodiac sign from the star atlas of Jan Hevelius of the 17th century is depicted, to which the coin is dedicated, as well as the corresponding constellation. Above – there is the chased image of the symbol of the given sign. Below – a symbolic modern image of the zodiac sign, painted with gold paint, against the background of a model of the solar system. There is also a coined name for the corresponding zodiac sign in Latin, face value and purity.

name: Niue Island Coin Set dedicated to the Coliseum
description:
Note: total face value of the set – 2 New Zealand dollars, total estimated net weight - 52.3 g. 
The obverse of the coins depicts a portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain, Face value and the year of issue. 
The reverse of the first coin depicts a battle of gladiators; the background is a color image of the Coliseum,;at the bottom between the two daggers, there is an inscription in Latin “FORTIUS” (stronger). 
The reverse of the second coin depicts a triga (a chariot drawn by three horses), in the background, there is a color image of the ancient Greek circus Maximus racecourse (Circus Maximus), below the two wheels, there is an inscription in Latin “CITIUS” (faster).

name: Coin of Niue Island series "Crimea", dedicated to the Swallow's Nest
description:
The coin has a shape corresponding to the outlines of the Crimean peninsula. 
The obverse shows a view of the Black Sea with Mount Ayu-Dag (Bear Mountain), located on the southern coast of Crimea. 
On the left, there is a portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain. 
The reverse depicts the Swallow's Nest - a famous architectural and historical monument on Cape Ai-Todor, which has become a symbol of the southern coast of Crimea. Sea waves washing a rock with a castle are depicted on the reverse in color.
original_equipment: blister combined with an authenticity certificate

name: Coins of the Republic of Macedonia of the Zodiac Series.
description:
On the obverse of the coins in the center, there is an hourglass, on the left – there is a color image of the sun, on the right – a crescent with stars, above – the coat of arms of the Republic of Macedonia and the inscription “РЕПУБЛИКА МАКЕДОНИJA”, below - the year of issue of coins, face value, and purity. Also along the contour there are 8 symbols denoting the signs of the zodiac. 
On the reverse of the coins on the left side, there is the zodiac sign to which the coin is dedicated. Part of the zodiac sign is painted in gold paint. 
On the right side of the coin, there is a round insert made of cobalt glass, which shows the starry sky and the constellation of the corresponding zodiac sign. On the contour of the coin, there is an ornament (for each coin its own), also made with gliding of individual elements. At the bottom of the coin, there is a symbolic designation and the name of the corresponding zodiac sign in Latin.

name: Coins of the Republic of Macedonia of the Zodiac Series.
description:
On the obverse of the coins in the center, there are Atlantes holding the vault of heaven framed by the symbols of the zodiac signs. On the insert made of cobalt glass (weighing 2.9 ±0.2 g), there is an image of the northern sky with the constellation corresponding to the name of the coin. Below – there is a fragment of a drawing of the solar system on the background of a star map. There is also an image of the coat of arms of the Republic of Macedonia and the inscription “РЕПУБЛИКА МАКЕДОНИJA”, below – there is the year of issue of coins - 2018. 
On the reverse of the coins in the upper part, the zodiac sign from the star atlas of Jan Hevelius of the 17th century is depicted, to which the coin is dedicated, as well as the corresponding constellation. Above – there is the stamped image of the symbol of the given sign. Below – there is a symbolic modern image of the zodiac sign, painted in gold paint, against the background of a model of the solar system. There is also a coined name for the corresponding zodiac sign in Latin, face value and purity.

name: Coins of Niue Island dedicated to the utstanding Russian poets of the Golden Age A.S. Pushkin and M.Yu. Lermontov
description:
The obverse of the coins depicts a portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain. 
On the reverse of the coins, crafted in the same style, in the foreground, there is a colored portrait of the poet (on the first coin - A.S. Pushkin, on the second coin - M.Yu. Lermontov) and on the background – a fragment of a color illustration to one of his works. The upper part of the reverse with the inscription "Poets of the Golden Age" (in English) has gilding. At the bottom of each coin, there is a feather with an inkwell.
original_equipment: blister combined with an authenticity certificate

name: Coin of Niue Island of the Crimea series, dedicated to the Livadia Palace.
description:
The coin has a shape corresponding to the outlines of the Crimean peninsula. 
The obverse shows a view of the Black Sea with Mount Ayu-Dag (Bear Mountain), located on the southern coast of Crimea. 
On the left is a portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain. 
The reverse shows the Livadia Palace with fragments of the palace and park ensemble. Below – there is a flowering branch of dog rose, made by pad printing. 
On the right - there is the inscription in Russian: “ЛИВАДИЙСКИЙ ДВОРЕЦ” (LIVADIA PALACE).
original_equipment: blister combined with an authenticity certificate

name: Coins of the Republic of Benin Series "Romantic Places of the World"
description:
The obverse depicts the national emblem of the Republic of Benin and the face value. 
On the reverse of each coin, landscapes of romantic places with silhouettes of couples in love are shown in color: the first coin depicts the landscape of London, the second – Barcelona. At the top of each coin, there is an inscription in French “LES PLACES ROMANTIQUES” (romantic places) and an inscription of a romantic place (in English), to which the coin is dedicated.
original_equipment: blister combined with an authenticity certificate

name: Coin of Niue Island dedicated lottery
description:
The obverse of the coin depicts a portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain. 
On the reverse in the center there is a round color insert made using special technology that provides the effect of a changing image. If you look at the insert, gradually changing the angle of view, you can see 4 consecutive frames of a rotating lottery drum with balls. Around the insert there are inscriptions with keywords (in English), separated by images of game balls characterizing the lottery: “dream”, “luck”, “victory”, “fate”, “lot”. The original coin case is made in the form of a 6 out of 49 lottery playing field with six metal balls and allows you to make a “bet on luck”.
original_equipment: certificate of authenticity, case stylized as a lottery field

name: Coins of the Republic of Benin
description:
The obverse depicts the national emblem of the Republic of Benin. 
On the reverse of the first coin in the center, a winged horse is depicted in color. Above – there is an inscription in English and French “YEAR OF THE HORSE” and “ANNЙE DU CHEVAL” (year of the Horse). Below – there is an image of a horseshoe and a Chinese character for a horse. 
On the reverse of the second coin in the center, the silhouette of a horse painted in Khokhloma- style is depicted in color. Above - there is an inscription in English and French “YEAR OF THE HORSE” and “ANNЙE DU CHEVAL” (Year of the Horse), framed by holographic drawings of flowers. Below – there is a holographic floral pattern.
original_equipment: Winged horse (Benin)– 14 - certificate of authenticity; Khokhloma horse (Benin)– 14 - blister combined with an authenticity certificate

name: Coins of Tanzania “Love is Precious”
description:
Insert description: 2 bronze butterflies weighing 2.36 g, plated with silver and 18 carat gold. There are 4 river pearls, each weighing 0.0175, are inserted into each butterfly. 
The obverse of the coin depicts the coat of arms of Tanzania, the year "2017 " and the face value of 1000 shillings. 
The reverse of the coin shows polished ribbons on the edge of the coin, a color image of an orchid flower. There are inscriptions "Love is Precious." On a magnetic mount in the center of the coin, an insert of two butterflies is fixed.An additionally enclosed in the set chain is made of brass and coated with silver.

name: Coins of the Republic of Macedonia "The Holy Blessed Matrona of Moscow"
description:
On the obverse of the coin are depicted: on top – the coat of arms of the Republic of Macedonia, face value 100 denars in Macedonian, year of issue 2017, weight 31.1 g and purity silver 925 in English; in the center – a fragment of the Pokrovsky stavropegial nunnery located in Moscow, which currently houses the relics of St. Matrona of Moscow (in the background – there are the outlines of the same monastery); at the bottom is the inscription Republic of Macedonia in Macedonian. 
On the reverse of the coin is a color image of the Matrona of Moscow, surrounded by a gold ornament. In the upper part, there is an inscription: Holy Blessed Matrona of Moscow in Russian.

name: Coins of the Forest Cubs Series
description:
The obverse of the coins depicts a portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain, the inscription “QUEEN ELIZABETH II” on the top, and the inscription “50 CENTS TUVALU 2013.” 
On the reverse of the coins in the center, there is the image of a forest animal (baby cub / baby squirrel / baby bear) made in color. Above is an inscription with the name of the animal (“GRAY WOLF” / “RED SQUIRREL” / “BROWN BEAR”).
original_equipment: blister combined with an authenticity certificate

name: Coin of Niue Island "Sea of Love"
description:
Note: Swarovski crystal in the form of a heart, weighing 0.07 g, diameter 6.12 mm 
The obverse depicts a portrait of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II. There are inscriptions: “Elizabeth II, Niue, One Dollar” in English, year of manufacture “2017”, weight “15,55g” purity “Ag 925”. 
On the reverse of the coin in the central part, there is a chased image of two pigeons against the background of a colored landscape of sunrise over the surface of the sea. To the right – there is a chased symbolic image of a girl and a young man in love. Below – there is an insert of a Swarovski crystal in the form of a red heart and the inscription "Sea of Love" – in English.
original_equipment: capsule, blister combined with an authenticity certificate, lace

name: Coin of the Republic of Benin of the series “Romantic Places of the World”
description:
The obverse depicts the national emblem of the Republic of Benin. 
On the reverse of the coin, the landscape of a romantic place in front of the main building of Moscow State University with the silhouette of a couple in love is depicted in color. Above – there is an inscription in French “LES PLACES ROMANTIQUES” (romantic places) and an inscription in English “MOSCOW”.
original_equipment: blister combined with an authenticity certificate

name: Bridges (Niue) – 15 A set of Niue Island coins dedicated to the bridges of St. Petersburg and Paris.
description:
Note: total face value of the set – 4 New Zealand dollars, total accounting net weight - 62.2 g. 
The obverse of the coins depicts a portrait of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II, as well as the lights of the Trinity Bridge (left) and Alexander III Bridge (right). There are inscriptions: "Niue 2015, Elizabeth II, Two dollars." 
On the reverse of the first coin on the left, there is a color image of the Trinity Bridge on the background of the Peter and Paul Cathedral. 
On the right, there are chased images of fragments of this bridge and the monogram of Emperor Nicholas II. There are inscriptions: “Trinity Bridge, St. Petersburg ". 
On the reverse of the second coin on the left, there is a hammered image of a fragment of the bridge of Alexander III and the coat of arms of Paris located on this bridge. 
On the right, there is a color image of the Eiffel Tower. There are inscriptions: "Pont Alexandre III, Paris". The case is made in the form of a bridge with rising wings.
original_equipment: capsule, 2 certificates of authenticity (in English and Russian, respectively), case

name: Moto emblem-17
description:
A silver coin with a face value of 1 ruble (the mass of the precious metal is 7.78 g, purity of alloy 925) has a round shape with a diameter of 25.0 mm. 
On the obverse and reverse of the coin around the circumference there is a protruding edging. On the front side of the coin, there is a relief image of the State Emblem of the Russian Federation, there are inscriptions: “RUSSIAN FEDERATION”, “BANK OF RUSSIA”, face value of coins – “1 RUBLE,” the year of issue – 2017, and a metal designation according to the Periodic system of elements D. AND. Mendeleev, alloy purity, trademark of the Moscow Mint and the mass of the precious metal. On the back of the coin (catalog number 5109-0118), there is an image of the emblem of the Ground Forces of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation, at the bottom – there is an inscription “Motor Rifle Troops” along the circumference. The edge of the coin is reeded. The coin is of "proof" quality. The mintage is 5000 pieces.

name: Coin of the Republic of Tanzania,
description:
The obverse of the coins depicts the state emblem of the Republic of Tanzania. There are inscriptions "Tanzania 2016 1000 shillings". 
On the reverse – there are sculptures of three monkeys against a Japanese pagoda and blooming sakura in color. There are inscriptions “Wisdom.Мудрость”

name: Coins of Niue Island, the "Sculpture World" Series
description:
The obverse of the coin depicts a portrait of the sculptor Auguste Rodin – the author of the famous sculptures on the reverse. 
On the obverse of each coin, there are also the national emblem of Belarus and inscriptions typical for the front side of the coin. The coin reverse depicts the sculpture "The Thinker."

name: Coins of Niue Island featuring the Famous Gothic Cathedrals
description:
The coin is dedicated to the famous Gothic cathedral of Europe, the French Cathedral of Notre Dame (Notre Dame). The design of the coin includes an image of fragments of the architecture of the cathedral, as well as a color image of a circular fragment of one of its stained-glass windows (depicting the Virgin Mary), the imitation of which is achieved by repeating it in a mirror image on the back of the coin. 
The obverse of all coins also contains a portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain and typical inscriptions. 
The obverse of the first coin depicts a view of Notre Dame Cathedral from the southern facade, as well as a fragment of the contour image of one of its round stained-glass windows - the so-called “rosette”. The greenery surrounding the cathedral is done in color. 
The reverse depicts (fragmentarily) the main facade of the cathedral, its internal architecture and one of the “rosettes” windows. 
On the obverse of the second coin, there is a view of Cologne Cathedral from the southern facade, as well as a fragment of the contour image of one of its stained glass windows. The greenery surrounding the cathedral is done in color. 
The reverse depicts (fragmentarily) the main facade of the cathedral and its plan. 
On the obverse of the third coin, there is a fragment of the Cathedral in Milan, a top view. 
The reverse shows a fragment of the main facade of the cathedral, as well as a fragment of the contour image of one of its stained glass windows.

name: Fan shaped coin of the Republic of Tanzania, dedicated to the year of the Monkey of the lunar calendar
description:
The coin is made in the form of a Chinese fan. 
The obverse of the coins depicts the state emblem of the Republic of Tanzania. There are inscriptions "Tanzania 2016 1000 shillings". 
The reverse depicts monkeys and a tree branch in the style of Chinese painting in color, on the left - a Chinese character denoting a monkey.

name: Coin of the Republic of Macedonia of the Zodiac Series.
description:
On the obverse of the coin in the center, there is an hourglass, on the left – there is a color image of the sun, on the right – a crescent with stars, above - the emblem of the Republic of Macedonia and the inscription “РЕПУБЛИКА МАКЕДОНИJA”, below - the year of issue of the coins (for the zodiac signs Leo, Virgo, Libra, Scorpio, Sagittarius, Capricorn “2014”, for the remaining signs “2015”), face value and purity. Also along the contour there are 8 symbols denoting the signs of the zodiac. 
On the reverse of the coin on the left side, there is the zodiac sign to which the coin is dedicated. Part of the zodiac sign is painted in gold paint. 
On the right side of the coin, there is a round insert made of cobalt glass, which shows the starry sky and the constellation of the corresponding zodiac sign. On the contour of the coin, there is an ornament (for each coin its own), also made of individual gilded elements. At the bottom of the coin, there is a symbolic designation and the name of the corresponding zodiac sign in Latin.

name: Zodiac signs Rwanda coins of the Zodiac Series (with diamond inserts)
description:
On the obverse of the coins, in the center, there is the national emblem of the Republic of Rwanda. 
On the reverse of each coin, framed by a ring of graphic symbols of the twelve signs of the zodiac, there is a gilded image of a person, animal or object symbolizing the zodiac constellation to which the coin is dedicated, against the background of stylized clouds and stars (the stars of the zodiac constellation are highlighted by gilding). Four stars of the zodiac constellation are made in the form of diamond inserts weighing 0.002 g each.

name: Coins of the Republic of Macedonia of the Zodiac Series
description:
On the obverse of the coins in the center, there are Atlantes holding the vault of heaven framed by the symbols of the zodiac signs. On the insert made of cobalt glass (weighing 2.9 ±0.2 g), the image of the northern sky with the constellation corresponding to the name of the coin. Below – there is a fragment of a drawing of the solar system on the background of a star map. There is also an image of the coat of arms of the Republic of Macedonia and the inscription “РЕПУБЛИКА МАКЕДОНИJA”, below is the year of issue of coins “2018”. 
On the reverse of the coins in the upper part, the zodiac sign from the star atlas of Jan Hevelius of the 17th century is depicted, to which the coin is dedicated, as well as the corresponding constellation. Above – there is the stamped image of the symbol of the given sign. Below is a symbolic modern image of the zodiac sign, painted in gold paint, against the background of a model of the solar system. There is also a coined name for the corresponding zodiac sign in Latin, face value and purity.

name: Coins of Singapore featuring the orchids
short_name: Orchids (set) (Niue) – 13. Short names of the coins separately: White Orchid (Niue) – 13, Yellow Orchid (Niue) – 13.
description:
The obverse of the coins depicts the emblem of Singapore. 
On the reverse of the coins, there are color images of orchids of two hybrid varieties; they are the first of more than four hundred new varieties that were received by Singapore breeders as part of the state program for hybridization of orchids since 1928. The first coin depicts vanda amy, the second – spathoglotis primrose (the corresponding Latin name for the variety is also indicated on the reverse).
original_equipment: certificate of authenticity, cases (for the set and each individual coin)

name: Coin of Australia featuring the octopus, the Life of the Sea series
description:
The obverse depicts a portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain. 
On the reverse, in the center, there is a color image of an octopus.

name: Coins of Tuvalu, the Deadly Animals series
description:
The obverse of the coins depicts a portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain. 
The reverse of each coin depicts one of five species of predatory animals that inhabit the Australian continent: a red-backed spider, an Australian blue-ringed octopus, a great white shark, an Australian eastern brown snake, and an Australian sea crocodile. The individual reverse elements of each coin are highlighted in color. Also on the reverse, there are inscriptions with the main parameters of the coin and the Russian and Latin names of the depicted animal.

name: Coin of Niue Island, "Art of Hunting" series
description:
On the obverse, at the top, there is a hunting dog of the Pointer breed in the rack, below – a portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain. 
The reverse shows a scene of a fox hunt: on the left in the foreground is a fox in color, on the right - there is a dog chasing her; in the background – English horse hunters.
original_equipment: blister combined with an authenticity certificate

name: Coin of the Republic of Tanzania, the Love is Precious Series
description:
The coin is made in the shape of a heart. 
The obverse of the coin shows the emblem of the Republic of Tanzania, the face value and the year of issue. 
On the reverse side of the coin, two peacocks are shown in color, sitting on a branch, amid a colorful landscape. Below – an inscription in English "Love is precious".

name: Coins of the Republic of Benin, the "Romantic Places of the World" Series
description:
The obverse depicts the national emblem of the Republic of Benin. 
On the reverse of each coin, landscapes of romantic places with silhouettes of couples in love are shown in color: on the first coin – the landscape of Paris is depicted, on the second - St. Petersburg, on the third - Bavaria. At the top of each coin, there is an inscription in French “LES PLACES ROMANTIQUES” (romantic places) and an inscription of a romantic place (in English), to which the coin is dedicated.
original_equipment: blister combined with an authenticity certificate

name: Coins of Tuvalu, the Deadly Animals series
description:
The obverse of the coins depicts a portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain. 
The reverse of each coin depicts one of five species of predatory animals that inhabit the Australian continent: a red-backed spider, an Australian blue-ringed octopus, a great white shark, an Australian eastern brown snake, and an Australian sea crocodile. The individual reverse elements of each coin are highlighted in color. Also on the reverse, there are inscriptions with the main parameters of the coin and the Russian and Latin names of the depicted animal.

name: Coins of Armenia, the Kings of Football Series
description:
The logo of the series is depicted 
On the obverse of the coins - the inscription “Kings of Football”, made in the form of a throne on a pedestal and crowned with a stylized crown. The logo is complemented by images of two lions and a ball. The state emblem of the Republic of Armenia is located below the main image. 
On the reverse of each coin is a portrait of one of the three famous football players: Pele, Eusebio– against a stylized flying ball with a bright trail, made in the colors of the national flag of the corresponding athlete of the country: Brazil, Portugal and the USSR.

name: Coin of Niue Island, "How man conquered the sky,"
description:
The obverse of the coin shows the technical plan of the wing of the Antonov plane, to the right of which is the engine of the aircraft with a propeller, and to the left is a silhouette fragment of the bow of an acrobatic plane, as well as a spread wing of the bird. 
On the left side of the obverse, there is an image of a portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain. At the top, there is an inscription with the name of the series (in English). 
The reverse depicts the world's first airplane with a Flyer-1 engine, as well as portraits of its designers - the brothers Orville and Wilber Wright (USA).

name: Coin of Niue Island, the Cartoon Characters Series
description:
On the obverse at the top, there is a portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain, at the bottom - stylized films and individual frames depicting cartoon characters. 
The reverse center shows the main character of the well-known in our country Polish multi-part animated film directed by L. Marshalek “Reksio”, 65 episodes of which were created in 1967-88. Next to the dog Reksio, who holds balloons, there are his friends are a cock and a kitten. Images of a dog with balls, as well as flowers in the grass, are made in color.
original_equipment: blister combined with an authenticity certificate

name: Coins of Tanzania, the Hourglass set
description:
The obverse of the coins depicts the state emblem of the Republic of Tanzania. There are inscriptions in English: Tanzania 2016 250 shillings. 
On the reverse of the first coin, there is a color image of the clock hands on the background of various watch dials and minted images of various watches, their names and approximate dates of their appearance (invention): solar (1500 BC), water (1400 BC) , sand (150 BC), mechanical (723), spring (1510), pendulum (1656), atomic (1949), electronic (1956). 
On the reverse of the second coin, there is a color image of the watch mechanism. There is also a hammered image of the dial of the watch with Roman numerals.

name: Peter the Great (Niue) -15
description:
The obverse depicts a portrait of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II. There are inscriptions: "Elizabeth II, 2015, Niue Island, Fifty Dollars". Also around the coin circumference, there are scenes from events related to the history of Russia, with the participation of Peter I: the capture of Azov in 1696, the capture of Narva in 1704, the Battle of Poltava in 1709, the signing of the Decree on the introduction of assemblies in 1718, the salvation of drowning soldiers from Lakhta in 1724, The Carpenter King. 
The reverse of the coin depicts: on the right side - Peter I framed by laurel leaves, surrounded by monograms of the emperor, above and below the portrait - the crown and coat of arms of the Russian Empire; they are depicted as a symbol of royal power. Below - there are the years of life 1672-1725. 
On the left side of the reverse, there is an image of the Peter and Paul Fortress against the background of the first historical map of St. Petersburg from the time of Peter I. Below – there is a statue from the sculptural ensemble of the Winter Palace and a view of the Neva River through the fence of the palace. Two schooners are depicted on the river: Ingermanland (Russian battleship built with the participation of Peter I) and Predestination (Russian battleship designed by Peter). At the top of the coin, there is an inscription “Peter the Great” and “Ag 925” under the image of the Peter and Paul Fortress. Frames of laurel leaves and a crown are covered with gold paint.

name: Coin of Niue Island dedicated to Russian Emperor Peter I
description:
The obverse depicts a portrait of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II. There are inscriptions: "Elizabeth II, 2017, Niue Island, 3000 Dollars". Also around the coin circumference, there are scenes from events related to the history of Russia, with the participation of Peter I: the capture of Azov in 1696, the capture of Narva in 1704, the Battle of Poltava in 1709, the signing of the Decree on the introduction of assemblies in 1718, the salvation of drowning soldiers from Lakhta in 1724, The Carpenter King. 
The reverse of the coin depicts: on the right side - Peter I framed by laurel leaves, surrounded by monograms of the emperor, above and below the portrait – the crown and coat of arms of the Russian Empire; they are depicted as a symbol of royal power. Below - there are the years of life 1672-1725 
On the left side of the reverse, there is an image of the Peter and Paul Fortress against the background of the first historical map of St. Petersburg from the time of Peter I. Below – there is a statue from the sculptural ensemble of the Winter Palace and a view of the Neva River through the fence of the palace. Two schooners are depicted on the river: Ingermanland (Russian battleship built with the participation of Peter I) and Predestination (Russian battleship designed by Peter). At the top of the coin, there is an inscription “Peter the Great” and “Ag 925” under the image of the Peter and Paul Fortress. Frames of laurel leaves and a crown are covered with gold paint.
original_equipment: capsule, certificate of authenticity, gift case

name: Coin of Tuvalu dedicated to the Victory Day in WWII
description:
The obverse of the coin depicts a portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain. The coin reverse depicts a Soviet soldier writing the word “victory” on the wall of the Reichstag. 
On the left there is a fragment of the red banner (the rest of which is shown on the blister), on the right – the St. George ribbon (in color).
original_equipment: blister combined with an authenticity certificate

description:
On January 9, 2007, the Bank of Russia issued an investment gold coin with a face value of 50 rubles depicting George the Victorious and the year of issue – 2007. A gold coin with a face value of 50 rubles (the mass of the precious metal is 7.78 g, purity alloy 999, catalog number 5216-0060) has a round shape with a diameter of 22.6 mm. 
On the obverse and reverse of the coin around the circumference there is a protruding edge. 
On the obverse of the coin, there is a relief image of the emblem of the Bank of Russia - a two-headed eagle with its wings down, under it there is an inscription in a semicircle " БАНК РОССИИ " (BANK OF RUSSIA) – in a circle framed by a bead rim; also, around the circumference there are inscriptions separated by dots: "ПЯТЬДЕСЯТ РУБЛЕЙ" (FIFTY RUBLES) – the face value of the coin and the year of minting – 2007; between them, there is a metal designation according to the Periodic system of chemical elements Mendeleev, its purity, brand name of the mint and the mass of the precious metal. 
On the reverse, the coin has a relief image of George the Victorious on a horse, striking a serpent with a spear. The edge of the coin is reeded. The mintage is 500 000 pieces. Issued coins are the legal tender of the Russian Federation and are required to be accepted at face value in all types of payments without any restrictions.

name: Coin of Niue, dedicated to the first human space flight
description:
The obverse of the coin depicts a portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain. 
On the reverse in the foreground is a color holographic stylized image of the brand with a portrait of Yu. Gagarin and a launching rocket. In the background, the Mir space station is depicted against the backdrop of the Earth and a spiral galaxy. 
On the right, there is an inscription: "Flight to the stars" in English.
original_equipment: blister combined with an authenticity certificate

name: Coin of the Republic of Macedonia, the Zodiac Series
description:
On the obverse of the coin in the center, there is an hourglass, on the left - there is a color image of the sun, on the right – a crescent with stars, above - the emblem of the Republic of Macedonia and the inscription “РЕПУБЛИКА МАКЕДОНИJA”, below – the year of issue of the coins (for the zodiac signs Leo, Virgo, Libra, Scorpio, Sagittarius, Capricorn “2014”, for the remaining signs “2015”), face value and purity. Also along the contour, there are 8 symbols denoting the signs of the zodiac. 
On the reverse of the coin on the left side, there is the zodiac sign to which the coin is dedicated. Part of the zodiac sign is painted in gold paint. 
On the right side of the coin there is a round insert made of cobalt glass, which shows the starry sky and the constellation of the corresponding zodiac sign. On the contour of the coin there is an ornament (for each coin its own), also made with the golden color of individual elements. At the bottom of the coin, there is a symbolic designation and the name of the corresponding zodiac sign in Latin.

name: Coins of the Republic of Macedonia of the Zodiac Series
description:
On the obverse of the coins in the center, there are Atlantes holding the vault of heaven framed by the symbols of the zodiac signs. On the insert made of cobalt glass (weighing 2.9 ±0.2 g), the image of the northern sky with the constellation corresponding to the name of the coin. Below – there is a fragment of a drawing of the solar system on the background of a star map. There is also an image of the coat of arms of the Republic of Macedonia and the inscription “РЕПУБЛИКА МАКЕДОНИJA”, below is the year of issue of coins “2018”.
