On the reverse of the coins in the upper part, the zodiac sign from the star atlas of Jan Hevelius of the 17th century is depicted, to which the coin is dedicated, as well as the corresponding constellation. Above – there is the stamped image of the symbol of the given sign. Below is a symbolic modern image of the zodiac sign, painted in gold paint, against the background of a model of the solar system. There is also a coined name for the corresponding zodiac sign in Latin, face value and purity.

name: Coin of Andorra dedicated to Auguste Renoir, Artists of the World Series
description:
The obverse of the coin depicts (partially in color) a fragment of the famous painting by the French impressionist Auguste Renoir, "Girls at the Piano." The coat of arms of the Principality of Andorra is located in the lower right corner. The face value of the coin (10 diners) is given 
On the obverse with the abbreviation (“10 D.”). 
The reverse depicts a fragment (inscribed in the borders of a stylized palette and made in color) of one of Renoir’s most famous paintings “Jeanne Samari” against the backdrop of a relief portrait of the artist.

name: Coins of Tuvalu dedicated to the ancient warriors of different peoples of the world
description:
The obverse of the coins depicts a portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain. 
The reverse of each coin depicts a colored figure of one of the four types of ancient warriors: a Viking (Scandinavia), a Roman legionnaire (Ancient Rome), a knight (Western Europe) and a samurai (Japan). 
The reverse design of each coin is supplemented (in the background) by a recognizable symbol associated with the depicted warrior and his country, as well as an inscription with the name of the warrior.

name: Coins of Rwanda dedicated to the inhabitants of the coral reef
description:
The obverse of the coins depicts the state emblem of the Republic of Rwanda. 
On the reverse of each coin at the top, a seascape with a wave and an island is stylized, below – there is the main image of the coin, made in color: an underwater landscape with one of the typical representatives of the animal world of coral reefs: a green turtle, a Caribbean reef shark. To the right on the reverse there is also a relief image of a seahorse.

name: Coins of Rwanda featuring the Cats of Various Breeds
description:
The obverse of the coins depicts the state emblem of the Republic of Rwanda. 
On the reverse of each coin, there is a colorful image of a cat of one of the breeds: Russian Blue and Maine Coon - and her kittens, who are in their home environment (inside the house or on the street). Also at the top of the reverse is the name of the breed of the depicted cat.

name: Coins of the Republic of Macedonia, the Russian Labyrinth
description:
On the obverse of the coin are depicted: at the top - the coat of arms of the Republic of Macedonia, in the center - a minted maze that allows you to move the ball on the surface of the coin. On the coin there are inscriptions: Republic of Macedonia and the face value of 100 denars in Macedonian, as well as the winged expression “through thorns to the stars” in Latin, year of issue 2017. 
On the reverse, there is a color image of the labyrinth, built by decree of Peter the Great near the Monplaisir Palace on the shores of the Gulf of Finland; it is made of specially selected shrubs, and later called the “Garden at the Tempel Pavilion”. There are also stamped portraits of Peter I, who began the construction of the labyrinth, and Anna Ionanovna, who completed the construction, against the backdrop of the Grand Palace in Peterhof. There are inscriptions: Peter the Great, Anna Ioannovna and the Russian labyrinth in Russian.

name: Australian coin featuring the Blue Surgeonfish, the Life of the Sea series
description:
The obverse depicts a portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain. 
On the reverse in the center, there is a color image of a surgeon fish.

name: Coin of the Republic of Macedonia, the Zodiac Series
description:
On the obverse of the coin in the center, there is an hourglass, on the left – there is a color image of the sun, on the right – a crescent with stars. Above - the coat of arms of the Republic of Macedonia and the inscription “РЕПУБЛИКА МАКЕДОНИJA”, below – the year of issue of coins, face value, purity. Also along the contour there are 8 symbols denoting the signs of the zodiac. 
On the reverse of the coin on the left side, there is the zodiac sign to which the coin is dedicated. Part of the zodiac sign is painted in gold paint. 
On the right side of the coin there is a round insert made of cobalt glass, which shows the starry sky and the constellation of the corresponding zodiac sign. On the contour of the coin there is an ornament (for each coin its own), also made with the golden color of individual elements. At the bottom of the coin, there is a symbolic designation and the name of the corresponding zodiac sign in Latin.

name: Coin of Niue Island, the Alphonse Mucha Zodiac Series
description:
On the obverse of the coins in the center, there is a portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain, around which there are symbolic images of the zodiac signs enclosed in circles. The main part of the reverse of each coin is stylized according to the works of the famous Czech modernist artist Alfons Mucha and includes a favorite plot of the artist’s creations - a woman’s portrait (executed in color) against a background of a complex ornament (the images of the reverses differ). 
The obverse of the silver coins of Niue Island, the Alphonse Mucha Zodiac Series partially minted in 2011 (starting with the sign of Pisces and all the way to the sign of Sagittarius), is identical to the cited obverse of the coins of this series.

name: Coins of the Republic of Macedonia of the Zodiac Series.
description:
On the obverse of the coins in the center, there are Atlantes holding the vault of heaven framed by the symbols of the zodiac signs. On the insert made of cobalt glass (weighing 2.9 ±0.2 g), the image of the northern sky with the constellation corresponding to the name of the coin. Below – there is a fragment of a drawing of the solar system on the background of a star map. There is also an image of the coat of arms of the Republic of Macedonia and the inscription: “РЕПУБЛИКА МАКЕДОНИJA” (REPUBLIC OF MACEDONIA), below – the year of issue of coins – “2018”. 
On the reverse of the coins in the upper part, the zodiac sign from the star atlas of Jan Hevelius of the 17th century is depicted, to which the coin is dedicated, as well as and the corresponding constellation. Above – there is the stamped image of the symbol of the given sign; below – symbolic modern image of the zodiac sign, painted in gold, against the background of a model of the solar system. There is also a coined name for the corresponding zodiac sign in Latin, face value and purity.

name: Coin of the Republic of Tanzania with a picture of a child
description: The obverse of the coin shows the emblem of the Republic of Tanzania, the face value and year of issue. A child surrounded by cabbage leaves is depicted in color in the center of the reverse. On the contour, there are 5 images of a baby against the background of small hearts. At the bottom – there is the inscription in English "Happy Birthday." There is a baby rattle in a case; the coin is inserted in the rattle.

name: Coins of the Republic of Tanzania dedicated to the botanical gardens
description:
The obverse of the coins shows the emblem of the Republic of Tanzania, the face value and the year of issue. 
The reverse center of the first coin shows the representatives of the flora of the Peter the Great Botanical Garden in St. Petersburg in color: yellow crocuses on the left, white prickly pear and white water lily on the right. Above – there is the building of the Botanical Garden, as well as the inscription in English "Botanical Garden of Peter the Great St Petersburg."

name: Coin of Fiji dedicated to the Victory Day in World War II
description:
The obverse depicts a portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain. 
On the reverse in color is a festive salute over the Moscow Kremlin. The St. George ribbon and the inscription in Russian “САЛЮТ ПОБЕДЫ!” (Salute of victory!) are depicted at the bottom.
original_equipment: Capsule, blister combined with an authenticity certificate

name: Coin of the Republic of Macedonia Holy Faith, Hope, Love and their mother Sofia
description: The top part of the obverse depicts the coat of arms of the Republic of Macedonia, year of issue and the face value. In the center, there are fragments of stained glass from the Church of St. John in the village of Landenny (Wales, UK) with the image of saints; below – an image of the Church of St. Trofim (Alsace, France), where the relics of the saints were transferred from Rome in 777. At the bottom, there is the name of the issuer. The center of the reverse depicts Saint Faith, Hope, Love and their mother Sophia. Along the contour, the coin has a frame in the form of a pattern. Inscriptions are done in Macedonian "St. Faith, St. Hope, St. Love, Hagia Sophia.”

name: Coin of the Republic of Macedonia "Orthodox Saints"
description:
The obverse of the coin shows the emblem of the Republic of Macedonia. There are inscriptions: Republic of Macedonia and the face value of 10 denars in Macedonian, as well as the year of release - 2018. A stylized ornament is depicted along the perimeter. 
On the reverse, there is an iconographic image of Seraphim of Sarov against a background of a stylized ornament. Nimbuses of saints are covered with gold paint. There are also inscriptions in the Macedonian language with the names of the respective saints. Above the image of the saints, there are inserts of Swarovski crystals (with a weight of 0.0066 g and a diameter of 1.8 mm). At the bottom, there is purity notation – 925, sterling silver.

name: Coins of the Republic of Belarus of the Orthodox Saints series made in gold
description: The main element of the obverse is the image of a stylized Orthodox church framed by a stylized patterned arch. Pr. Seraphim of Sarov is depicted on the reverse of the coins against the background of a stylized ornament with insets of Swarovski crystals (red and green).
original_equipment: blister combined with an authenticity certificate

name: Coin of the Republic of Belarus of the Orthodox Saints series
description:
The obverse of the coin shows the emblem of the Republic of Macedonia. There are inscriptions: Republic of Macedonia and the face value of 10 denars in Macedonian, as well as the year of release – 2018. A stylized ornament is depicted along the perimeter. 
On the reverse, there is an iconographic image of Sergius of Radonezh against a background of a stylized ornament. Nimbuses of saints are covered with gold paint. There are also inscriptions in the Macedonian language with the names of the respective saints. Above the image of the saints there are inserts of Swarovski crystals (with a weight of 0.0066 g and a diameter of 1.8 mm). At the bottom, there is purity notation – 925, sterling silver.

name: Malawi Coin featuring the Snowman
description:
On the obverse, there is a portrait of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain. 
On the reverse depicts a snowman driving a sled with a bear harnessed to them – against the background of a winter forest landscape. The relief image of a snowman and sleigh partially has gilding. The eyes and “buttons” of the snowman, as well as the eyes of the bear, are made in the form of inserts from a faceted synthetic translucent stone of a dark gray shade (a total of 6 inserts weighing 0.002 g each). At the same time, we inform that the obverse of the silver coin “Snowman (Malawi) - 09”, the description of which was sent earlier (letter No. 76-02 / 3100 of 11/18/09), depicts the state emblem of the Republic of Malawi.

name: Coin of Kazakhstan featuring the snow leopard
description:
The obverse depicts the state emblem of Kazakhstan; it is located at the top of a vertical patterned strip. 
The reverse depicts two snow leopards sitting on a hillside.

name: Coins of Niue Island, series dedicated to the famous Gothic cathedrals
description:
The coins of this series are united by their elliptical shape, as well as the design with a color image of a round fragment of one of the stained-glass windows of the cathedral, an imitation of which is achieved by repeating it in a mirror image on the reverse. 
On the obverse of the first coin, against the background of the general view of the interior of the Spanish Cathedral, one of its shrines is depicted – a wooden crucifix of the 16th century. 
On the obverse of the second coin, the general view of the Prague Cathedral is partially depicted in color. In addition, the obverses of these coins depict a portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain and inscriptions that are typical for the front of a coin. 
The reverse of the first coin shows a general view of the Cathedral of St. Eulalia against the background of the contour image of one of its stained glass windows.

name: Coins of Niue Island, series dedicated to the famous Gothic cathedrals
description:
Another coin of the series is dedicated to the Mariacki Church (Church of the Assumption of the Blessed Virgin Mary) in Polish Krakow – the main Catholic cathedral of the city. In the center of the obverse, there is a fragment of the main shrine of the temple – the altar with the image of the wedding of Our Lady with the crown of the Lady of Heaven. In the top part of the obverse, like in other coins of the series, a round fragment of one of the stained glass windows of the church is depicted in color. Also 
On the obverse, there are a portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain and inscriptions that are typical for obverses. 
The reverse depicts a fragment of a general view of the Mariacki Church against the background of the contour image of the architectural lines of its interior. In the upper part of the reverse, there is a color image of the stained-glass window available 
On the obverse, in mirror image.

name: Soviet Cars Niue Island Coin Set dedicated to Soviet cars
description:
Note: total face value of the set – 8 New Zealand dollars, total net accounting weight – 124.40 g. 
The obverse of the coins depicts a portrait of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain. 
On the reverse of each coin against the backdrop of the city landscape with a Soviet-built building, one of the four most famous models of Soviet mass-produced passenger cars is depicted: on the first coin - GAZ-M20 “Victory” (1946), on the second coin - Moskvich-400 (1946), on the third coin - GAZ-12 "ZiM" (1950) and on the fourth coin - GAZ-21 "Volga" (1956). The main image of each coin is made in color.

name: Coins of Australia of the Lunar Calendar series
description: The obverse of the coins depicts a portrait of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain. Gold coins depict the head of a tiger.

name: Coins of the Niue Island dedicated to the Year of the Tiger
description:
The obverse of the coins depicts a portrait of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain. 
The reverse of the coin depicts a tiger cub lying in a basket and playing with a yarn ball. The yarn ball image is done in color.

name: Coins of the Republic of Belarus of the World Flower History Series
description:
In the central part of the obverse of the second coin, a bouquet of flowers is depicted. 
On the left, there is a multi-color image of a lily of the valley, another flower from the series. In the upper part - there is the coat of arms of the Republic of Belarus. On the circumference of the inscription in the Belarusian language: “РЭСПУБЛIКА БЕЛАРУСЬ” (REPUBLIC OF BELARUS), “10 РУБЛЁЎ” (10 RUBLES), “2013” (the year of mintage). In the central part of the reverse of the first coin, there is a multi-color image of violets; in the background, there is a relief fragment of violets. Below, on the circumference - the inscription: Viola (Latin name of the flower).
original_equipment: blister combined with an authenticity certificate

name: A set of coins of the Republic of Tanzania dedicated to the flagships
description: Note: total face value of the set – 2000 Tanzanian shillings, total net accounting weight – 80 g.

name: Football-18
description:
Coin dedicated to the 2018 FIFA World Cup 2018 in the Russian Federation is an investment silver coin with a face value of 3 rubles (the mass of the precious metal is 31.1 g, purity 999, catalog number 5111-0349); it has a round shape and a diameter of 39.0. 
On the obverse and the reverse of the coin, there is a protruding edging around the circumference. 
On the obverse of the coin, there is a relief image of the state emblem of the Russian federation, under it there are inscriptions: "РОССИЙСКАЯ ФЕДЕРАЦИЯ" (RUSSIAN FEDERATION) "БАНК РОССИИ" (BANK OF RUSSIA), "ТРИ РУБЛЯ" (THREE RUBLES) – the face value of the coin and the year of minting – 2018; also, there is a metal designation according to the Periodic system of chemical elements Mendeleev, its purity, brand sign of the St. Petersburg Mint and the mass of the precious metal. On the back of the coin there is a relief image of the FIFA World Cup, on the right there is an inscription in five lines - “ЧЕМПИОНАТ МИРА ПО ФУТБОЛУ FIFA 2018 В РОССИИ” (FIFA World Cup 2018 in RUSSIA). The edge of the coin is reeded. The coin is of "uncirculated" quality (without a mirror surface). Mintage – silver coins with a face value of 3 rubles - up to 300 thousand.

name: Tuvalu coin featuring the Cathedral of Christ the Savior
description:
The obverse of the coin depicts a portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain. 
The reverse depicts the Cathedral of Christ the Savior in Moscow, built by decree of Emperor Alexander I in honor of the victory of the Russian army in the Patriotic War of 1812. 
The reverse image is partially made in color.
original_equipment: blister combined with an authenticity certificate

name: Princess Frog -17
description:
Silver coins with a face value of 3 rubles of the series "Legends and Tales of the Peoples of Russia" (the mass of the precious metal is 31.1 g, purity of alloy - 925) has a round shape with a diameter of 39.0 mm. 
On the obverse and the reverse of the coins, there is a protruding edging around the circumference. 
On the obverse of the coin, there is a relief image of the state emblem of the Russian Federation; below, there are inscriptions: "РОССИЙСКАЯ ФЕДЕРАЦИЯ" (RUSSIAN FEDERATION) "БАНК РОССИИ" (BANK OF RUSSIA), "ТРИ РУБЛЯ" (THREE RUBLES) – the face value of the coins and the year of minting – 2017. Also, there is a metal designation according to the Periodic system of chemical elements Mendeleev, its purity, brand sign of the St. Petersburg Mint and the mass of the precious metal. 
The reverse of the Frog Princess coin (catalog number 5111 - 0372) depicts: relief images of the characters of the fairy tale “The Frog Princess” – in the center, below – an ornament made in color, at the top – the inscription “ЛЕГЕНДЫ И СКАЗКИ НАРОДОВ РОССИИ” (LEGENDS AND TALES OF THE PEOPLES OF RUSSIA). The edge of the coin is reeded. The coins is of “proof” quality. The mintage is 5000 pieces of each kind.

name: Coin of Niue Island dedicated to the Royal Hunt, made in silver
description:
By design, the silver coin repeats the previously issued gold coin of this series (with the exception of inscriptions with technical specifications). The center of the obverse depicts a fragment of the icon of St. Tryphon (which is considered the patron saint of hunting in Russia); below – there is a portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain, as well as inscriptions that are for the obverse. 
The reverse depicts a fragment of K. Lebedev’s illustration “Departure of Tsar Alexei Mikhailovich to the Falconry from the Spassky Gate of the Kremlin” for the second volume of “Grand Duke, Tsarist and Imperial Hunting in Russia” by N. Kutepov (1898).

name: Coins of Niue, dedicated to the royal stables
description:
The obverse of the coins depicts a portrait of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II and the inscription: "NIUE ISLAND", the face value and "ELIZABETH II," – at the top in the center. In the center, there is a relief image of a fragment of an engraving of a view of the royal stables in Peterhof by K. Venerman, 19th century. Below - there are the inscriptions in English: “Saint Petersburg / Peterhof”. Down the center – there is a portrait of Nikolai Leontyevich Benoit, the architect of the stables, made by digital ptrinting; below it - there is the name and surname of the architect in English: “Architect Nicholas Benois”. Around the circumference – there are decorative ornaments: laurel and oak branches, typical for the Empire style and common during the reign of Nicholas I. 
On the left, between the branches - there is metal denotation and its purity. 
On the right, between the branches – there is the year of mintage (2013). 
On the reverse, at the top in the center, the coins have an inscription in English: “Imperial Stables” (Royal Stables), made in the form of a scroll. On the sides – there are portraits of Emperor Nicholas I and Empress Alexandra Fedorovna, made by digital printing. Under the portraits are inscriptions in English - “Emperor Nicholas I” and “Empress Alexandra Feodorovna.” In the center – there is a relief image of a fragment of O. Verne’s Tsarskoye Selo Carousel depicting Nicholas I and his wife on horses in medieval clothes against the backdrop of the Alexandria Cottage and the Imperial Stables. At the bottom, around the circumference – there is a decorative floral ornament. The edge of the coin has its numerical order.

name: Coin of Niue dedicated to William Shakespeare
description:
The obverse of the coin is made in a form of a book cover: on the left – there is a portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain, on the right – a portrait of W. Shakespeare in color. 
The reverse of the coin is made in the form of a book spread, which depicts the heroes of the works of W. Shakespeare from left to right: Hamlet, Juliet, Romeo, King Lear. The coin case is made in the form of a book. 
The reverse of the coin is made in the form of a book spread on which the characters of the works of W. Shakespeare are depicted from left to right: King Lear, Romeo, Juliet, Hamlet.
original_equipment: certificate of authenticity combined with the case

name: Coin of Niue Island dedicated to school
description:
The obverse of the coin depicts a portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain. 
The reverse depicts a boy and a girl color in a school; they are wearing uniforms and are holding a globe. In the foreground, there is a bouquet of gladioli - a Russian symbol of the beginning of the school year, a traditional gift from a schoolchild to a teacher on the Knowledge Day. The inscription at the bottom of the reverse is a winged Latin expression and translates as "Through the difficult to the great."
original_equipment: Case in a shape of a school board, certificate of authenticity

name: Set of coins of the Republic of Tanzania on the evolution of the calendar
description:
On the obverse of the first coin, there is a stamped image of the coat of arms of Tanzania, surrounded by flowers on the right and left, year “2017” and the face value 1000 shillings. 
On the reverse of the first coin, there is a stamped image of Julius Caesar and Pope Gregory 13 with dates 46 BC and 1582. Also chased images of dates, days of the week, months and years. 
On the obverse of the second coin, there is a stamped image of the coat of arms of Tanzania, year “2017” and the face value 1000 shillings. 
On the reverse of the second coin, there is a color image of calendar representations in Egyptian, Babylonian and Chinese cultures. There are also symbolic images of tear-off calendar sheets with the most famous holiday dates (January 1, March 8, June 12 and November 4). There is a stamped image of the most important dates in the development of the calendar (Babylonian calendar 3000 BC, Chinese calendar 1400 BC, Egyptian calendar 500 BC, Mayan calendar 380 BC, Julian calendar 46 g BC, Gregorian calendar 1548 g).

name: Coin of Niue, dedicated to the Soviet rock opera "Juno and Avos"
description:
The obverse of the coin depicts a portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain. In the background behind the portrait, there is a partially colored fragment of the cover of the first record with the original recording version of 1980 of the rock opera Juno and Avos, staged at the Lenin Komsomol Moscow Theater (Lenkom). 
The reverse depicts the leading performers Nikolai Karachentsev (as Count Rezanov) and Elena Shanina (as Conchita). Portraits of actors are embedded in the image of the sea landscape with a sailing sailboat and the evening sky with the setting sun (done in color), which symbolize the inevitability of the separation of loved ones. The name of the rock opera, also available on the reverse, is in Russian language.
original_equipment: blister combined with an authenticity certificate

name: Coin of Niue Island featuring the Egg Dedicated to the Patriotic War of 1812, the Faberge Imperial Eggs Series
description:
The Easter Egg depicted on a coin (called "Napoleonic") was made by Carl Faberge's workshop in 1912 in memory of the victory in the Patriotic War of 1812 by order of Emperor Nicholas II as a gift for his mother - Empress Maria Fedorovna. The egg with the coat of arms of the Romanov dynasty (double-headed eagle) and military attributes has a surprise in the form of a folding screen with six miniatures, which depict representatives of various regiments of the empress. At the top of the obverse, there is a portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain; at the bottom - the Spring Flowers Egg. 
The reverse depicts the Napoleonic Egg and six miniatures of the folding screen made in color. The image of the egg is decorated with two inserts of translucent red crystals.

name: Coin of Niue Island featuring the Egg Made for Duchess of Marlborough,
description:
The Duchess of Marlborough egg was made in 1902 for the American Duchess Consuelo of Marlborough; its design repeated the egg “Clock with the Blue Snake” of 1887. The watch dial is made in the form of a bezel on an egg, which rotates slowly, and the snake serves as a stationary clock hand. The top of the obverse depicts a portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain; the bottom - the Spring Flowers egg. 
The reverse of the coin depicts the top of the Duchess of Marlborough egg. The background of the egg depicts the image of hanging strands of pearls. The top of the egg and the head of the snake are decorated with inserts of translucent red crystals.

name: Coin of Niue Island of the Faberge Imperial Eggs Series
description: In the upper part of the obverse, there a portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain; in the lower part – the Spring Flowers ​​egg. The central part of the reverse depicts a stylized image of the Cathedral of the Assumption of the Blessed Virgin Mary, which is located on the territory of the Moscow Kremlin. On the sides is the semicircular name of the Faberge egg in English “MOSCOW KREMLIN EGG”. In the background is a neorococo decorative ornament.

name: Coin of Niue Island of the Faberge Imperial Eggs Series
description: In the upper part of the obverse, there a portrait of Queen Elizabeth II of Great Britain; in the lower part – the Spring Flowers egg. In the center, the reverse depicts a stylized image of the original Trans-Siberian Railway egg with gilded elements against the background of the map of Russia of the late XIX / early XX centuries. Below – there is a gilded image of a model of a steam locomotive with wagons. Below the image, there is an inscription in English “Faberge EGGS.”

name: Coins of Tanzania, the Kalashnikov Set
description:
The emblem of Tanzania is depicted in the central part of the first coin and there are inscriptions in English 2018 (year of issue) / TANZANIA / 1000 SHILLINGS (face value). In the central part of the reverse of the first coin, there are stamped images of the first building of the Izhevsk Arms Plant and a bas-relief of a woman on the throne, covered by a large combat shield; she is distributing weapons to the soldiers. The image symbolizes Russia, arming its sons to protect the fatherland. 
On the left – there is a color portrait of Andrei Deryabin. In the central part – there is a color image of a 1808 model rifle. A little above – there is a color image of the tape with the dates 1807-2017. In the center of the reverse of the second coin, there are hammered images of the building of the Izhevsk Arms Plant and a woman with a miniature shield and scepter. The image symbolizes Russia's openness to peaceful international dialogue and cooperation. 
On the right, there is a color portrait of Mikhail Kalashnikov. In the central part, there is a color image of the AK-47 assault rifle. A little above – there is a color image of the ribbon with dates – 1807-2017. Coins are packed in a gift demonstration case in the form of a prototype Kalashnikov assault rifle, 2 pcs.

name: Coins of Tanzania, the Checkers Set
description: The emblem of Tanzania is depicted in the central part of the first coin and there are inscriptions in English 2018 (year of issue) / TANZANIA / 250 SHILLINGS (face value). Along the perimeter, are chased images of Chinese characters for each of the animals of the Lunar Chinese calendar. In the central part of the reverse of the first coin, there is a hammered image of the “Lunar Zodiac” fountain located in the Old Summer Palace in Beijing. In a circle, there are images of the heads of animals that were previously included in the architectural composition of the fountain. The coin has a rhodium coating. In the central part of the obverse of the second coin, there is the coat of arms of Tanzania, the year “2018” and face value - ‘250 shillings’. On the perimeter, there are chased images of zodiac signs. In the central part of the reverse of the second coin, there is a chased image of the Sun, the Moon and stars. In a circle, there are images of zodiac signs on the background of constellations. Zodiac signs and the rays of the Sun are gold plated. Coins are packed in a gift demonstration case of 12 pcs of each kind.

name: Coin of the Republic of Macedonia “Wheel of Fortune”

name: Coin of the Republic of Congo dedicated to the Year of the Pig

On the obverse, there is a stamped image of the coat of arms of Tanzania, the year “2019” and the face value ‘500 shillings’.

name: Coins of Rwanda of the Zodiac Series (with diamond inserts)
description:

On the reverse of each coin, in the frame of a ring containing graphic symbols of the zodiac signs, there is a gilded image of an animal symbolizing the zodiac constellation to which the coin is dedicated – against the background of stylized clouds and stars (the stars of the zodiac constellation are also highlighted by gilding). name: Coins of the Republic of Macedonia of the Zodiac Series.
description:
On the obverse of the coin in the center, there is an hourglass, on the left - there is a color image of the sun, on the right – a crescent with stars, above - the emblem of the Republic of Macedonia and the inscription “РЕПУБЛИКА МАКЕДОНИJA”, below - the year of issue of the coins (for the zodiac signs Leo, Virgo, Libra, Scorpio, Sagittarius, Capricorn “2014”, for the remaining signs “2015”), face value and purity. Also along the contour, there are 8 symbols denoting the signs of the zodiac. 
On the reverse of the coin on the left side, there is the zodiac sign to which the coin is dedicated. Part of the zodiac sign is painted in gold paint. 
On the right side of the coin there is a round insert made of cobalt glass, which shows the starry sky and the constellation of the corresponding zodiac sign. On the contour of the coin there is an ornament (for each coin its own), also made with the golden color of individual elements. At the bottom of the coin, there is a symbolic designation and the name of the corresponding zodiac sign in Latin.

On August 3, 2005, the Bank of Russia issued a gold coin of the Zodiac series in denomination of 25 rubles featuring the Sagittarius sign. The gold coins of the Zodiac series with the face value of 25 rubles (the mass of the precious metal is 3.11 g, its purity is 999) with an image of the Sagittarius zodiac have a round shape and a diameter of 33.0 mm and 16.0 mm, respectively. 
The obverse and the reverse of the coins have a protruding edging around the circumference. 
On the obverse of the coins, there is a relief image of the emblem of the Bank of Russia - a two-headed eagle with its wings down; below it, there is an inscription in a semicircle "БАНК РОССИИ" (BANK OF RUSSIA) in a circle framed by a bead rim, and around the circumference, there are inscriptions separated by dots: face value of coins - "ДВАДЦАТЬ ПЯТЬ РУБЛЕЙ"(TWENTY FIVE RUBLES) and the mintage year - "2005." Between the inscriptions there are: the metal mark according to the Periodic Table of Elements D.I. Mendeleev, the trademark of the St. Peretsburg Mint and the mass of the precious metal. 
The reverse side of the coins depicts relief images of a warrior in armor, pulling a bow string and personifying Sagittarius - one of the twelve signs of the Zodiac, stars from the zodiac constellation Sagittarius, its sign and floral pattern. The edge of the coins is reeded. The gold coins with the face value of 25 rubles are of “uncirculated” quality (without the mirror surface); silver coins with the face value of 2 rubles – of “proof” quality. The mintage of the gold coins with the face value of 25 rubles is 20000 pcs.

name: Save Our World
description:
On October 3, 2011, the Bank of Russia issued commemorative coins of precious metals – silver coins with a face value of 100 rubles, of the series “Save Our World” (featuring the Central Asian leopard). Silver coins with a face value of 100 rubles (the mass of the precious metal is 1 kg, purity – 925), of the series “Save Our World” (the Central Asian leopard) have a round shape with a diameter of 100.0 mm. 
The obverse and the reverse of the coins have a protruding edging around the circumference. 
On the obverse of the coins, there is a relief image of the emblem of the Bank of Russia - a two-headed eagle with its wings down, under it there is an inscription in a semicircle "БАНК РОССИИ" (BANK OF RUSSIA) in a circle framed by a bead rim, and around the circumference there are inscriptions separated by dots: face value of coins - "СТО РУБЛЕЙ"(HUNDRED RUBLES) and the year of minting - "2011." Between the inscriptions there are: the metal mark according to the Periodic Table of Elements D.I. Mendeleev, alloy purity, the trademark of the Moscow Mint and the mass of the precious metal. 
The reverse of the coin with the face value of 100 rubles – is a relief image of two Central Asian leopards against the background of mountains and two mountain goats; below – there is an inscription "СОХРАНИМ НАШ МИР" (SAVE OUR WORLD). The silver coin with the face value of 100 rubles is of “proof” quality. The mintage of the silver coin with the face value of 100 rubles is 500 pcs. Coins issued are the legal tender in cash on the territory of the Russian Federation and must be accepted at face value in all types of payments without any restrictions.

On December 18, 2013, the Bank of Russia issued commemorative coins of precious metals – silver coins with value of 3 rubles of the geographical series "Expeditions of G.I. Nevelsky to the Far East in 1848-1849 and 1850-1855." Silver coin with a face value of 3 rubles (the mass of the precious metal is 31.1 g, alloy purity 925). 
The obverse and the reverse of a coin have a protruding edging around the circumference there is. 
On the obverse of the coins, there is a relief image of the emblem of the Bank of Russia - a two-headed eagle with its wings down, under it there is an inscription in a semicircle "БАНК РОССИИ" (BANK OF RUSSIA) in a circle framed by a bead rim, and around the circumference there are inscriptions separated by dots: face value of coins - "ТРИ РУБЛЯ" (THREE RUBLES), "СТО РУБЛЕЙ"(HUNDRED RUBLES), "ДЕСЯТЬ ТЫСЯЧ РУБЛЕЙ" (TEN THOUSAND RUBLES), respectively, and the year of minting is "2013." Between the inscriptions there are: the metal mark according to the Periodic Table of Elements D.I. Mendeleev, alloy purity of the for coins with a face value of 3 rubles, purity for coins with a face value of 100 and 10 000 rubles, the trademark of the Moscow Mint and the mass of the precious metal. 
On the obverse of the gold coin with a face value of 10,000 rubles in the lower part next to the inscription indicating the mass of the precious metal, the serial number of the coin is indicated as "No." 
On the reverse of the silver coin with the face value of 3 rubles, there are images G.I. Nevelskoy and Russian sailors – at the time of landing on the banks of the Amur River and meeting with the local population on the background of the map of the Far East and to the right of a sailing ship, at the top of the circle there is an inscription: “ЭКСПЕДИЦИИ Г.И. НЕВЕЛЬСКОГО 1848-1855” (EXPEDITIONS OF G.I. NEVELSKOY OF 1848-1855). The edge of the coins is reeded. The silver coin with the face value of 3 rubles is of “proof” quality. The mintage of the silver coin with the face value of 3 rubles is 75000 pcs.

name: Coin of the Niue featuring the work of Ilya Glazunov, the Artists of the World Series
description:
In the upper part, the obverse depicts the name of the issuer state “Niue Island”; in the center, against the background of the landscape (made by digital printing) by Ilya Sergeyevich Glazunov “Summer. Suzdal” (1994) – there is a relief portrait of the artist. Below - there is a signature of Ilya Glazunov and the face value of the coin (1 DOLLAR). In the lower right part, there is a vertical inscription: Ag 925 (metal and its purity). 
On the left side, there is a portrait of Elizabeth II; below - there is the mint's trademark and vertical inscriptions: ELIZABETH II and 2015 (year of issue of the coin). 
On the reverse of the coin is a relief image of a fragment of the artist’s painting “Russian Beauty” (1968).

name: Coin of Niue Island dedicated to the miners of Kuzbass - the maincoal center of Russia

In the background is a stylized image of a mechanized tunneling shield used to create underground tunnels (image is partially color). name: Coin of Armenia dedicated to Jazz
description:
The obverse of the coin in the center depicts a jazz ensemble during a performance. The remaining design elements include fragments of stylized portrayals of typical jazz musical instruments: saxophone, trombone and piano. The main inscriptions

The reverse depicts stylized other attributes of jazz creativity: musical instruments: double bass, trumpet and percussion, as well as musical notation and a microphone. At the bottom, there is the inscription "JAZZ" in English and Armenian, made in color.

name: Australian coin from the series "Cubs of Animals - Inhabitants of the Australian Bush" featuring a Cub of Sugar Flying Possum

name: Coins of Singapore featuring the orchids
